snippet: John K. Castle, the former chief executive of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette and a founder of Castle Harlan, a private equity firm, has landed in hot water over a dispute with a waiter at Club Colette, a private dining club in Florida. According to The...
abstract: John K. Castle, the former chief executive of Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette and a founder of Castle Harlan, a private equity firm, has landed in hot water over a dispute with a waiter at Club Colette, a private dining club in Florida. According to The Palm Beach Daily News and Gawker, Mr. Castle took offense to a waiter who approached his table with a bill, calling him a "schmuck" and allegedly breaking the waiter's finger with a hard twist. No charges have been filed.

According to The Palm Beach Daily News and Gawker, Mr. Castle took offense to a waiter who approached his table with a bill, calling him a "schmuck" and allegedly breaking the waiter's finger with a hard twist. No charges have been filed. Read more »
